About.title: My Story
About.story1: It all started with a 486 PC my father brought home. While other kids were outside playing, I spent lots of hours on that machine, fascinated by the fact that it could run games like Prehistorik (I played that one a lot). That early curiosity about how things worked quickly turned into a passion for building them.
About.story2: Fast-forward past my Computer Science studies and early freelance gigs, my real education happened in the trenches. I worked on credit bureau systems across Latam, helped businesses launch websites in industries ranging from insurance to entertainment, and even contributed to the MetLife Stadium site just before Super Bowl XLVIII. Later came IoT infrastructure for smart cities at Aclara, job search features at Indeed, and streaming platforms at Warner Bros Discovery and PlutoTV.
About.story3: Fifteen years in, one truth stands out, software isn't about perfect code, it's about solving real problems.
About.story4: I've been a digital nomad, working with teams across continents and time zones. The sectors changed, but the principle stayed the same, if users can‚Äôt depend on what you ship, none of it matters. That belief led me to start Everbak. I was tired of watching brilliant ideas get stuck in endless ‚Äúdiscovery phases‚Äù. Two weeks is enough to validate if something has potential. If it does, we improve it. If not, we pivot or scrap it. No wasted time, no wasted money.
About.story5: When I‚Äôm not coding, I‚Äôm writing about the messy realities of software development, war stories from someone who‚Äôs been building stuff since that first 486 sparked a lifelong fascination. That same kid who used to mash the space bar to fight pixelated dinosaurs, now helps people ship products that actually work.

Skills.title: How I Ship MVPs in 2 Weeks
Skills.subtitle: The exact tech stack and approach that lets Everbak deliver production-ready products fast.
Skills.mvpStackDescription: Next.js 15 and React 19 for speed and reliability. TypeScript to catch mistakes early and keep your codebase predictable. Tailwind for responsive designs that look great on any device. PostgreSQL or MongoDB for robust data handling. Git for clean version control, Vercel for instant deployments. Built with an architecture you can grow on, following proven industry practices. You own everything, complete GitHub repository included.
Skills.aiDescription: We kick off with GPT-5 from OpenAI to spark ideas, explore possibilities, and shape the concept. Claude Code then maps out the architecture and plans the build. Vercel v0 quickly transforms those plans into functional prototypes. Finally, GitHub Copilot works alongside us in the IDE to refine and expand the code. AI takes care of the repetitive and time-consuming tasks, our human expertise focuses on strategy, creativity, and solving the problems that actually matter.
Skills.customDescription: Not every project fits the same mold, and that‚Äôs the fun part. Whether you prefer Astro over Next.js, want separate front-end and back-end repos, need a Go or Python backend, or are thinking microservices, AI integration, high-performance caching with Redis, complex database setups, multi-tenant architectures, or custom deployment pipelines, I‚Äôve been there. Tell me your vision, and we‚Äôll make it happen.
